title-part.text: RIDER PROPULSION OF WHEELED VEHICLES OR SLEDGES

CPC-specific-text.text: SINGLE-TRACK

title-part.text: TRANSMISSIONS SPECIALLY ADAPTED FOR SUCH VEHICLES

reference.text: arrangements or mounting of transmissions in vehicles in general B60K; transmission elements per se F16

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the term "transmission" means all parts between the prime mover or the part to which a rider immediately applies propulsive effort, e.g. pedal cranks, and a driven ground wheel.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: propulsion by ground-engaging rods B62M29/02
rider propulsion with additional source of power B62M6/00; propulsion by ground-engaging rods B62M29/02

title-part.text: involving devices which enable the mechanical storing and releasing of energy occasionally, e.g. arrangement of flywheels

title-part.text: operated by both hand and foot power
by means of a to-and-fro movable handlebar
with reciprocating levers, e.g. foot levers

reference.text: levers with can be immobilised as foot rests B62M5/00

title-part.text: characterised by rotary cranks combined with reciprocating levers
characterised by the use of flexible drive members, e.g. chains
characterised by the use of intermediate gears
characterised by directly driving the wheel axle, e.g. by using a ratchet wheel
by walking on an endless belt
with rotary cranks, e.g. with pedal cranks

reference.text: B62M1/34 takes precedence; combined with reciprocating levers B62M1/26; cranks which can be immobilised as foot rests B62M5/00

title-part.text: Rider propulsion of wheeled vehicles with additional source of power, e.g. combustion engine or electric motor

note.note-paragraph: In this main group, the first place priority rule is applied, i.e. at each hierarchical level, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the first appropriate place.

title-part.text: Rider propelled cycles with auxiliary combustion engine
power-driven at single endless flexible member, e.g. chain, between cycle crankshaft and wheel axle, the engine engaging the endless flexible member
power-driven by friction rollers or gears engaging the ground wheel
Rider propelled cycles with auxiliary electric motor
characterised by detectors or sensors, or arrangement thereof
with axle and driving shaft arranged coaxially
power-driven at single endless flexible member, e.g. chain, between cycle crankshaft and wheel axle, the motor engaging the endless flexible member
power-driven by friction rollers or gears engaging the ground wheel
Motorcycles characterised by position of motor or engine

reference.text: rider propulsion with addition source of power, e.g. auxiliary combustion engine or electric motor B62M6/00; frames characterised by position of engine B62K11/00

directly under the saddle or seat
with the engine over the rear wheel
with the engine over the front wheel
with the engine beside or within the driven wheel
with the engine on an auxiliary wheeled unit, e.g. trailer, sidecar

note.note-paragraph: In this main group, the first place priority rule is applied, i.e. at each hierarchical level, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the first appropriate place.
